### Week 3: Optimal Design & ML Foundations (Jan 26-28)

| Session | Date | Topic | Format |
|---------|------|-------|--------|
| 6 | Mon Jan 26 | Optimal Experimental Design & MIDA Framework | In-Person |
| 7 | Wed Jan 28 | ML Foundations for Causal Inference | In-Person |

**Session 6 Key Concepts:** Model-Inquiry-Data-Answer (MIDA), blocking, stratification, variance reduction (CUPED, Lin regression), cluster randomization

**Session 7 Key Concepts:** Prediction vs. estimation (Y-hard vs. β-hard), bias-variance tradeoff, cross-validation, regularization (Lasso/Ridge), tree-based methods

**Preparation for Session 7 (Required):**
- Watch: Jann Spiess videos (~90 min total)
  - [Applied ML: An Introduction](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G5qrBvOmzes)
  - [Applied ML: Secret Sauce](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qs6JmdNoT-Y)
  - [Applied ML: Prediction vs Estimation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e2Nmlk0cbrY)
- Read: ISLR Chapter 2 (Statistical Learning), Chapter 5 (Cross-Validation)

**Lab 1 assigned:** Experimental Design & Power (due Feb 2)

### Week 11: ML for Quasi-Experimental Methods (Mar 30 - Apr 1)

| Session | Date | Topic | Format |
|---------|------|-------|--------|
| 22 | Mon Mar 30 | ML-Enhanced Observational Causal Inference | In-Person |
| 23 | Wed Apr 1 | ML for DiD & Synthetic Controls | Remote |

**Key Concepts:** ML propensity scores, double-robust weighting, balancing weights, sensitivity analysis, ML-augmented DiD, synthetic control with regularization

**Prerequisites:** Assumes familiarity with basic quasi-experimental methods (DiD, IV, RDD) from prior coursework. See [Causal Inference: The Mixtape](https://mixtape.scunning.com/) for review.

*Note: April 2 is Well-Being Day (Thursday) — No impact on M/W schedule*

**Lab 6 assigned:** ML for Quasi-Experimental Methods (optional, due Apr 15)

### Week 12: Applied Causal ML & Integration (Apr 6-8)

| Session | Date | Topic | Format |
|---------|------|-------|--------|
| 24 | Mon Apr 6 | Sensitivity Analysis & Robustness | In-Person |
| 25 | Wed Apr 8 | Causal ML Integration & Frontiers | Remote |

**Session 24 Key Concepts:** Sensitivity analysis for unobserved confounding (E-values, Rosenbaum bounds), robustness checks across estimators, choosing the right method

**Session 25 Key Concepts:** End-to-end causal ML workflow, reporting best practices, **Frontiers: Adaptive Experimentation** (bandits, Thompson sampling, contextual bandits, targeted treatment assignment)

**Frontiers Reading (Optional):**
- [Susan Athey NBER 2024 Methods Lecture](https://www.nber.org/research/videos/2024-methods-lecture-susan-athey-analysis-and-design-multi-armed-bandit-experiments-and-policy) on bandits and policy learning
- [Stanford SIL Adaptive Experimentation](https://www.gsb.stanford.edu/faculty-research/labs-initiatives/sil/research/methods/adaptive-iterative-experimentation)

**Due:** Lab 5
